author: xtqqczze
body:
CodeQL security scanning, introduced in #13894, is failing bootstrap.

Logs show the following:
```
dotnet-install: Downloading link: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/5.0.100-rc.2.20479.15/dotnet-sdk-5.0.100-rc.2.20479.15-linux-x64.tar.gz
curl: (56) GnuTLS recv error (-54): Error in the pull function.
dotnet-install: Cannot download: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/5.0.100-rc.2.20479.15/dotnet-sdk-5.0.100-rc.2.20479.15-linux-x64.tar.gz
dotnet-install: Downloading legacy link: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/5.0.100-rc.2.20479.15/dotnet-dev-ubuntu.16.04-x64.5.0.100-rc.2.20479.15.tar.gz
curl: (22) The requested URL returned error: 404 Not Found
dotnet-install: Cannot download: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/5.0.100-rc.2.20479.15/dotnet-dev-ubuntu.16.04-x64.5.0.100-rc.2.20479.15.tar.gz
dotnet_install: Error: Could not find/download: `.NET Core SDK` with version = 5.0.100-rc.2.20479.15
dotnet_install: Error: Refer to: https://aka.ms/dotnet-os-lifecycle for information on .NET Core support
```

comments.author: xtqqczze
comments.body:
My guess is that the failure is because `dotnet-dev` packages for Ubuntu 16.04 are no longer available because support for this OS is being dropped in .NET 5.0. https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/master/release-notes/5.0/5.0-supported-os.md
GitHub
dotnet/core
Home repository for .NET Core. Contribute to dotnet/core development by creating an account on GitHub.

title: CodeQL security scanning is failing bootstrap
